title: Secondary Soft Skills
text:
Welcome
Welcome to the MACEPA Secondary Soft Skills tutorial. The purpose of these materials are to learn some general principles and best practices for working in a global health professional environment.
These lessons contain of materials developed by the MACEPA Data and Analytics teams, as well as external resources (links/citations have been included). Any data used in the tutorial will be public data and may have been adjusted from it’s source in order to be shared.
This tutorial is part of the MACEPA Data Fellowship program, all of our training materials are freely available at https://path-global-health.github.io/macepa-tech-training/.

title: 1  Turning Requests into Analysis
text: In this section of the Secondary Soft Skills module for the MACEPA Data Fellowship Program, we are going to focus on the tricky but important task of distilling actionable insights from vague requests, a standard in the global health and malaria working environment.

title: 2  Storytelling with Slides
text: In this section of the Secondary Soft Skills module for the MACEPA Data Fellowship Program, we are going to focus on how to use your powerpoint slide decks not just to impart information, but to tell a memorable story. This is a key step in turning your data analysis into memorable and actionable insights for policymakers.

title: 3  Turning an analysis into paper
text: In this section of the Secondary Soft Skills module for the MACEPA Data Fellowship Program, we are going to focus steps for taking an internal analysis and preparing a manuscript.

##Delivering a training course 101
In this section of the Secondary Soft Skills module for the MACEPA Data Fellowship Program, we share some tips and best practices for designing and running a training course for R or other data analysis skills.
